summary: Quick standup-style check-in: introductions and roles were stated. QA requested a specific 'Ready for testing!' posting format; PM asked for priorities; Architect offered to review and unblock design/technical decisions.

actions.task: When a feature is Ready for testing, post "Ready for testing!" with the expected output so QA (Jordan) can run tests
Clarify and communicate what the team should focus on today
Be available to review architecture, answer design questions, and unblock technical decisions when the team raises them

risks.risk: Testing delayed or ineffective because features are not posted with the expected output or the required "Ready for testing!" tag
risks.mitigation: Team must follow QA's instruction: include the exact phrase and the expected output when marking items Ready for testing

risks.risk: Team may lack daily focus/priorities leading to misaligned work
risks.mitigation: PM (Sarah) should set and communicate clear priorities for the day to the team
